DOC.brief_summary: This study design discern use lumbosacral orthesis ( LSO , also call back support ) improve short-term outcome lower back pain . participant receive standard care ( physical therapy , physician treatment ) , one group also receive extensible LSO , another group receive inextensible LSO . The inextensible LSO show increase stiffness trunk individual wear . The hypothesis group wear inextensible LSO improve outcomes two group ( standard care standard care plus extensible LSO ) .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Extensible Inextensible Lumbosacral Orthoses Lower Back Pain
DOC.criteria: chief complaint lower back pain , without low extremity ( LE ) symptoms 150 subject recruit patient seek treatment low back pain spine specialty orthopaedic clinic , family practice physician , outpatient physical therapy clinic Exclusion criterion : previous spinal surgery workman 's compensation litigation involve neurological disease injury systemic inflammatory disease pulmonary disease restrict breathe capacity current pregnancy acute fracture tumor metastatic disease infection neurological disease presence pathological reflex ( e.g. , Babinski ) presence low extremity pain upon cervical motion / presence two follow sign nerve compression : diminish low extremity strength myotomal distribution , diminish sensation , / absence deep tendon reflex .
